## 1) Johnson e Wichern - Exercício 9.1.
Show that the covariance matrix
$$\rho = \begin{bmatrix}
 1 & .63 & .45\\
 .63 & 1 & .35\\
 .45 & .35 & 1
\end{bmatrix}
$$

for the $p=3$ standardized random variable $Z_{1}$,  $Z_{2}$ e $Z_{3}$ can be generated by the $m=1$ factor model

$$Z_{1} = .9F_{1} + \epsilon_{1}$$
$$Z_{2} = .7F_{1} + \epsilon_{2}$$
$$Z_{3} = .5F_{1} + \epsilon_{3}$$ 

where $Var(F_{1})=1$, $Cov(\epsilon,F_{1})=0$, and

$$Cov(\epsilon) = \begin{bmatrix}
 .19 & 0 & 0\\
 0 & .51 & 0\\
 0 & 0 & 1
\end{bmatrix}$$
